title: Schedule of Ratings - Endocrine System
description: Rating criteria for diabetes, thyroid, and other endocrine conditions

diabetes_mellitus.name: Diabetes mellitus

levels.criteria: Manageable by restricted diet only
Requiring insulin and restricted diet, or; oral hypoglycemic agent and restricted diet
Requiring insulin, restricted diet, and regulation of activities

Requiring insulin, restricted diet, and regulation of activities with episodes of ketoacidosis or hypoglycemic reactions requiring one or two hospitalizations per year or twice a month visits to a diabetic care provider, plus complications that would not be compensable if separately evaluated

Requiring more than one daily injection of insulin, restricted diet, and regulation of activities (avoidance of strenuous occupational and recreational activities) with episodes of ketoacidosis or hypoglycemic reactions requiring at least three hospitalizations per year or weekly visits to a diabetic care provider, plus either progressive loss of weight and strength or complications that would be compensable if separately evaluated

regulation_of_activities.definition: Avoidance of strenuous occupational and recreational activities

presumptive_connection.agent_orange: Type 2 diabetes is presumptive for Agent Orange exposure

diabetes_mellitus.complications_note: Compensable complications are rated separately. Non-compensable complications support higher diabetes rating.

7900.name: Hyperthyroidism, including toxic diffuse goiter (Graves' disease), toxic multinodular goiter, and toxic adenoma of thyroid

levels.criteria: Tachycardia, tremor, and increased pulse pressure or blood pressure, which may be intermittent, and continuous medication required for control

Tachycardia, tremor, and increased pulse pressure or blood pressure, which may be intermittent, and continuous medication required for control, and emotional instability, fatigability, and significant weight loss
Emotional instability, tachycardia, fatigability, and increased pulse pressure or blood pressure, and weight loss and cachexia

Thyroid enlargement, tachycardia (more than 100 beats per minute), eye involvement, muscular weakness, loss of weight, and sympathetic nervous system, cardiovascular, or gastrointestinal symptoms, and emotional instability, weight loss, cachexia, and delirium

7900.note: If disease results in cardiac arrhythmia or heart disease, evaluate under the appropriate cardiac diagnostic code

levels.criteria: Hypothyroidism manifested by fatigability, constipation, and mental sluggishness when continuous medication is required for control
Fatigability, constipation, and mental sluggishness
Fatigability, constipation, and mental sluggishness and muscular weakness, mental disturbance, and weight gain
Muscular weakness, mental disturbance, and weight gain and cold intolerance, cardiovascular involvement, and bradycardia (less than 60 beats per minute)
Cold intolerance, muscular weakness, cardiovascular involvement, mental disturbance (dementia, slowing of thought, depression), bradycardia (less than 60 beats per minute), and sleepiness
Requiring medication for control
With characteristics of disfigurement (moon facies, buffalo hump) and striae
With characteristics of disfigurement and one of the following: proximal muscle wasting, psychiatric disturbance, or cardiomegaly
As active, progressive disease including all characteristics and two of the following: proximal muscle wasting, psychiatric disturbance, or cardiomegaly, or complications of treatment
With polyuria, polydipsia, dehydration, increased specific gravity of urine, requiring continuous hormonal therapy
With polyuria, polydipsia, dehydration, increased specific gravity of urine, and one or two hospitalizations per year or twice a month visits to a physician for stabilization

With polyuria, polydipsia, dehydration, increased specific gravity of urine, and more than two hospitalizations per year, or monthly visits to a physician for stabilization, or marked reduction in body weight
Requiring hormone supplementation and severe symptoms that are poorly controlled despite hormone therapy, and frequent hospitalizations or complete incapacity

important_rules: Diabetes Type 2 is Agent Orange presumptive
Regulation of activities must be medically prescribed to count for 40% rating
Diabetic complications are rated separately if compensable
Non-compensable complications support higher diabetes base rating
Thyroid conditions affecting heart may be rated under cardiac codes instead
